alert.note: Alert for Brevard; Orange; Seminole; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 29 at 6:27AM EDT until September 29 at 9:30AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Melbourne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Brevard County in east central Florida... East Central Orange County in east central Florida... Southeastern Seminole County in east central Florida... Southeastern Volusia County in east central Florida... * Until 930 AM EDT. * At 627 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 5 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Titusville, Oviedo, Rockledge, New Smyrna Beach, Edgewater, Cocoa, Cocoa Beach, Cape Canaveral, Wedgefield, Oak Hill, Mims, Haulover Canal, Scottsmoor, Titusville Airport, Port Saint John, Christmas, Playalinda Beach, Sharpes, Lone Cabbage Fish Camp and Chuluota. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
